metadata.focus: Mobile responsive design, touch targets, small viewport UX
metadata.method: CODE-BASED static analysis of Tailwind responsive classes, component structure, mobile-specific logic

scenario_results.title: Mobile sidebar navigation
scenario_results.details: UnionMobileSidebar uses Radix Sheet component (side='left', w-[280px]). Hamburger button in UnionHomeHeader has min size 44x44px (size-[44px]). Sidebar has proper nav aria-label, collapsible menus with aria-expanded, and focus-visible rings. Menu items have py-3 padding for adequate touch targets. Admin menu conditionally rendered for isAdmin only. Close on link click (handleLinkClick). SheetHeader is sr-only for a11y.

sub_tests.name: Sub-items accessible via Collapsible
sub_tests.evidence: UnionMobileSidebar.tsx:153 - Radix Collapsible with onOpenChange toggle

sub_tests.name: User menu in sidebar
sub_tests.evidence: UnionMobileSidebar.tsx:234-260 - expandable user menu with logout

sub_tests.name: Sidebar hamburger aria-controls
sub_tests.evidence: UnionHomeHeader.tsx:140 - aria-controls='mobile-sidebar', matching id on SheetContent

scenario_results.title: Mobile - Ads hidden on mobile viewport
scenario_results.details: UnionLayoutContent.tsx uses 'hidden md:block' for both left and right side ad aside elements. On mobile (<md breakpoint, <768px), ads are completely hidden and main content takes full width. Mobile layout uses flex-col stacking.

sub_tests.name: Main content full width on mobile
Layout switches from column to row at md
Landing page has no ads
sub_tests.evidence: UnionLayoutContent.tsx:86-96 - Landing page layout has no SideAdWidget

sub_tests.name: Admin page has no ads
sub_tests.evidence: UnionLayoutContent.tsx:99-120 - Admin page layout has no SideAdWidget

scenario_results.title: Mobile responsive layout for content pages
scenario_results.details: Most content pages use container mx-auto max-w-[1280px] px-4 which provides side padding on mobile. However, some issues found with union-info detail page title not being responsive, and admin members tab navigation potentially overflowing on narrow screens.

sub_tests.name: Notice detail page mobile layout
sub_tests.evidence: notice/[id]/page.tsx:74 - container mx-auto max-w-[1042px] px-4 py-8. Title text-[22px] readable. Meta info uses flex-wrap. Buttons stack with gap-4.

sub_tests.name: Free board detail page mobile layout
sub_tests.evidence: free-board/[id]/page.tsx:83 - responsive title text-[24px] md:text-[32px]. Meta uses flex-wrap. Buttons use flex gap-2.

sub_tests.name: QnA detail page mobile layout
sub_tests.evidence: qna/[id]/page.tsx:138 - responsive title text-[24px] md:text-[32px]. flex-wrap on title area and meta.

sub_tests.name: Union-info detail page mobile layout
sub_tests.evidence: union-info/[id]/page.tsx:80 - Title uses fixed text-[32px] without responsive breakpoint (no md: variant). On mobile this may cause text overflow or be too large.
sub_tests.expected: Title should use responsive sizing like text-[24px] md:text-[32px]

sub_tests.name: Union-info detail page title/buttons layout
sub_tests.evidence: union-info/[id]/page.tsx:79 - 'flex justify-between items-start' without flex-wrap. On mobile, title and buttons compete for horizontal space.
sub_tests.expected: flex-wrap with gap for mobile stacking
sub_tests.actual: No flex-wrap, buttons may overlap title on narrow screens

sub_tests.name: Prose content responsive images
sub_tests.evidence: free-board/[id]/page.tsx:118 - prose-img:max-w-full prose-img:h-auto prevents image overflow

sub_tests.name: Content area uses whitespace-pre-wrap
sub_tests.evidence: All detail pages use whitespace-pre-wrap with prose max-w-none, text wraps correctly

scenario_results.title: Mobile header layout and touch targets
scenario_results.details: UnionHomeHeader provides separate mobile (md:hidden) and desktop (hidden md:block) headers. Mobile header is 60px + safe-area-inset-top. Hamburger button is 44x44px. Center logo is absolutely positioned for balance.

sub_tests.name: Separate mobile/desktop header rendering
sub_tests.evidence: UnionHomeHeader.tsx:132 - 'md:hidden' for mobile, :173 - 'hidden md:block' for desktop

sub_tests.name: Safe area inset for notched phones

scenario_results.title: RegisterModal mobile fullscreen behavior
scenario_results.details: RegisterModal uses w-full h-full on mobile and md:w-full md:max-w-[480px] md:h-auto md:max-h-[90vh] md:rounded-2xl md:m-4 for desktop. This means fullscreen on mobile, centered card on desktop. Scrollable content area with overflow-y-auto.

sub_tests.name: Centered modal on tablet+
sub_tests.evidence: RegisterModal.tsx:1275 - 'md:w-full md:max-w-[480px] md:h-auto md:max-h-[90vh] md:rounded-2xl md:m-4'

sub_tests.name: Responsive padding (px-4 on mobile, px-6 on md+)
Responsive icon sizes
sub_tests.evidence: RegisterModal.tsx:165+ - Icons use 'w-6 h-6 md:w-7 md:h-7'

sub_tests.name: Close button touch target
sub_tests.evidence: RegisterModal.tsx:1286 - 'p-2 hover:bg-gray-100 rounded-full'. Computed size is approximately 36x36px (20px icon + 16px padding). Below 44x44px recommendation.

scenario_results.title: Landing page mobile responsiveness
scenario_results.details: LandingPage uses min-h-dvh (dynamic viewport height, accounts for mobile browser chrome), flex-col layout, px-4 padding. Content area is max-w-[500px]. Union name uses responsive text sizing.

sub_tests.name: Dynamic viewport height
sub_tests.evidence: LandingPage.tsx:128 - 'min-h-dvh' accounts for mobile browser address bar

sub_tests.name: Login form mobile margin
sub_tests.evidence: LoginForm.tsx:55 - 'mx-4 md:mx-0', extra margin on mobile

scenario_results.title: LoginForm mobile usability
scenario_results.details: LoginForm has adequate button height (h-12 = 48px), full width buttons, proper loading state. Kakao login button meets touch target requirements.

sub_tests.name: Login button height meets touch target
sub_tests.evidence: LoginForm.tsx:77 - 'w-full h-12' (48px height, well above 44px minimum)

sub_tests.name: Loading spinner feedback
sub_tests.evidence: LoginForm.tsx:115-135 - Loading indicator with spinner animation

scenario_results.title: NoticePopup mobile positioning and sizing
scenario_results.details: NoticePopup uses useMediaQuery for hydration-safe mobile detection. Mobile: full width minus margins, centered, top-4 fixed. Desktop: fixed 500px width with offset. Close button meets 44x44px.

sub_tests.name: Desktop offset only applied on desktop
sub_tests.evidence: NoticePopup.tsx:97-100 - isDesktop check before applying positional offsets

scenario_results.title: BlockedUserModal mobile display
scenario_results.details: Modal uses fixed inset-0 with p-4 padding for mobile safety margin. Inner card is max-w-md w-full which works well on mobile. Phone link is tappable.

sub_tests.name: Phone number is tappable tel: link

scenario_results.title: ApprovalPendingModal mobile display
scenario_results.details: Uses fixed inset-0 with p-4 edge padding. Card is max-w-md w-full. CTA button is h-12 (48px). Focus trap and ESC key handler active.

scenario_results.title: ApprovalRejectedModal mobile form usability
scenario_results.details: Edit mode form has scrollable content (max-h-[60vh] overflow-y-auto). Input fields are text-base (16px) which prevents iOS zoom on focus. Buttons are h-12. Form labels are properly associated.

sub_tests.name: Input font size prevents iOS zoom

scenario_results.title: LandingPageNew mobile responsive sections
scenario_results.details: Login section uses responsive padding py-12 md:py-16. Content constrained to max-w-[500px]. Heading responsive text-2xl md:text-3xl. Full min-h-dvh layout.

scenario_results.title: Skip navigation link visibility and usability
scenario_results.details: SkipNavLink component uses sr-only by default, becomes visible on focus with fixed positioning, z-[200], and themed styling. Works on all layout variants.

sub_tests.name: Present on all layout paths
sub_tests.evidence: UnionLayoutContent.tsx:89,102,127,147 - SkipNavLink rendered in landing, admin, home, and general layouts

scenario_results.title: Admin members page tab navigation on mobile
scenario_results.details: Tab navigation uses 'flex -mb-px' with no horizontal scrolling or wrapping. 4 tabs (each ~px-6 py-4 with icon+text) will overflow on screens narrower than ~500px. No overflow-x-auto or flex-wrap applied.

sub_tests.name: Tab overflow on mobile
sub_tests.evidence: admin/members/page.tsx:753 - 'nav class=flex -mb-px' with 4 tabs, each has px-6 padding. No overflow-x-auto.
sub_tests.expected: overflow-x-auto on nav container for horizontal scrolling, or responsive text/icon sizing
sub_tests.actual: Tabs will overflow and be clipped on mobile viewports

sub_tests.name: Tab touch target size
sub_tests.evidence: admin/members/page.tsx:757 - 'px-6 py-4' provides adequate touch area

scenario_results.title: Admin members approval tab search and filter on mobile
scenario_results.details: Search and filter section uses 'flex flex-col md:flex-row gap-4' which correctly stacks on mobile. However, the DataTable used for member listing may have horizontal overflow issues on narrow screens since it renders multiple columns (status, name, phone, address, role, date).

sub_tests.name: DataTable columns on mobile
sub_tests.evidence: 6 columns (status, name, phone, address, role, date) defined at line 658-730. DataTable component not inspected but multi-column tables typically need horizontal scroll on mobile.
sub_tests.expected: Table should have overflow-x-auto wrapper or responsive column hiding
sub_tests.actual: Cannot confirm without inspecting DataTable component, but risk of horizontal overflow

scenario_results.title: Admin members invite tab mobile layout
scenario_results.details: The invite management card header uses 'flex items-center justify-between' for the title and manual invite button. On narrow screens, these may overlap. The button group for template/upload/sync uses flex-wrap which is good.

sub_tests.name: Header title and button overlap
sub_tests.evidence: admin/members/page.tsx:818-836 - Title div and Button in flex justify-between without wrap. On mobile, the 'Manual Register' button may overlap the title text.
sub_tests.expected: flex-wrap or stack vertically on mobile
sub_tests.actual: Horizontal layout may cause overlap below ~400px width

scenario_results.title: SideAdWidget mobile behavior
scenario_results.details: SideAdWidget uses useMediaQuery to detect mobile and swap to mobile image if available. However, the widget is inside 'hidden md:block' containers in UnionLayoutContent, so it never renders on mobile. The widget itself handles mobile gracefully if ever shown.

scenario_results.title: Content detail pages image overflow prevention
scenario_results.details: Free board detail page applies prose-img:max-w-full prose-img:h-auto to prevent images from overflowing content area. Other detail pages use prose max-w-none which, combined with container padding, should contain images.

scenario_results.title: Notice detail page recent notices on mobile
scenario_results.details: Recent notices list uses flex items-center justify-between per row. Title has truncate and flex-1 min-w-0. Meta info has shrink-0 ml-4. Works on mobile but meta info may wrap.

sub_tests.name: Meta info positioning
sub_tests.evidence: notice/[id]/page.tsx:169 - 'shrink-0 ml-4' prevents meta from being squished

scenario_results.title: QnA detail page answer editor on mobile
scenario_results.details: The TextEditor component (TipTap) is rendered inside a p-6 container. TipTap editor toolbar accessibility on mobile is not verifiable from code alone. The answer buttons use flex justify-end gap-3 which may be tight on mobile.

sub_tests.name: TipTap editor mobile usability
sub_tests.evidence: Cannot verify TipTap toolbar mobile behavior from code alone. Toolbar buttons may be too small for touch. Requires runtime testing.
sub_tests.expected: Editor toolbar buttons should be 44x44px minimum
sub_tests.actual: Unknown - depends on TextEditor component implementation

scenario_results.title: Loading skeleton states on mobile
scenario_results.details: All detail pages use container-constrained Skeleton components with px-4 padding for mobile safety. Loading states render full-width skeletons appropriate for mobile.

scenario_results.title: Modal detail views on mobile (MemberDetailModal)
scenario_results.details: Member detail modal uses 'bg-white rounded-xl shadow-xl max-w-lg w-full max-h-[90vh] overflow-y-auto'. This constrains the modal properly and enables scrolling on mobile.

sub_tests.name: Form grid on mobile
sub_tests.evidence: admin/members/page.tsx:1241,1273 - 'grid grid-cols-2 gap-4' - adequate for most mobile widths

scenario_results.title: Reject modal on mobile
scenario_results.details: Reject modal uses 'max-w-md w-full' which works well on mobile. Textarea and buttons have adequate sizing.

scenario_results.title: Union inactive page mobile display
scenario_results.details: Inactive union page uses 'min-h-screen flex items-center justify-center p-4'. Card is 'max-w-md w-full'. Works well on mobile with centered content.

scenario_results.title: Mobile sidebar user account section
scenario_results.details: User section displays user avatar, name (truncated at 120px), and expandable account menu. Logout and 'My property' links have adequate touch targets.

sub_tests.name: Account menu button touch target
sub_tests.evidence: UnionMobileSidebar.tsx:236-260 - Full width button with py-3 padding

scenario_results.title: Free board (communication) detail mobile layout
scenario_results.details: Uses responsive title text-[24px] md:text-[32px], flex-wrap on meta/buttons, container with px-4 padding. Identical pattern to other detail pages.

scenario_results.title: Overall iOS-specific input zoom prevention
scenario_results.details: Key form inputs use text-base (16px) or text-[16px] which prevents iOS Safari from zooming in on input focus. This applies to RegisterModal, ApprovalRejectedModal, and admin search.

sub_tests.name: RegisterModal inputs
sub_tests.evidence: RegisterModal uses responsive font sizing, form inputs render with adequate size

issues_summary.title: Union-info detail page title not responsive
issues_summary.description: Title uses fixed text-[32px] without md: breakpoint variant. Other detail pages use text-[24px] md:text-[32px]. This causes oversized text on mobile.

issues_summary.title: Union-info detail page title/button row not wrapping
issues_summary.description: Uses 'flex justify-between items-start' without flex-wrap. On narrow screens, buttons may overlap title.
issues_summary.fix: Add flex-wrap and gap-4, or restructure to stack title above buttons on mobile

issues_summary.title: Admin members tab navigation overflows on mobile
issues_summary.description: 4 tabs with px-6 padding and icon+text in a simple flex container. No overflow-x-auto, so tabs get clipped on mobile screens.
issues_summary.fix: Add overflow-x-auto to nav container, or use responsive tab sizing

issues_summary.title: Admin invite section header may overlap on mobile
issues_summary.description: Title and 'Manual Register' button in flex justify-between without wrap may overlap on narrow screens.
issues_summary.fix: Add flex-wrap or stack vertically on mobile with flex-col sm:flex-row

issues_summary.title: RegisterModal close button below 44px touch target
issues_summary.description: Close button uses p-2 with 20px icon, resulting in ~36px touch target. Below Apple's 44px recommendation.
issues_summary.fix: Change p-2 to p-3, or add min-w-[44px] min-h-[44px]

issues_summary.title: TipTap editor toolbar mobile usability unknown
issues_summary.description: TipTap editor toolbar button sizes cannot be verified from code alone. May need runtime mobile testing.
issues_summary.fix: Verify TipTap toolbar buttons meet 44px minimum touch target on mobile

issues_summary.title: Admin DataTable may overflow horizontally on mobile
issues_summary.description: 6 columns defined for the user approval table. Multi-column tables typically overflow on mobile. Cannot verify without inspecting DataTable component.
issues_summary.fix: Ensure DataTable has overflow-x-auto wrapper or responsive column hiding

positive_findings: Separate mobile/desktop header with proper safe area insets for notched phones
RegisterModal goes fullscreen on mobile with scrollable content
Ads hidden on mobile via Tailwind hidden/md:block pattern
44x44px touch targets on hamburger menu button and NoticePopup close button
iOS zoom prevention with 16px (text-base) input font sizes
Dynamic viewport height (min-h-dvh) on landing page accounts for mobile browser chrome
Radix Sheet for mobile sidebar with proper ARIA attributes
Focus-visible rings on all interactive elements for keyboard/touch navigation
Responsive text sizing (text-3xl md:text-4xl) on key headings
flex-wrap on meta information rows prevents overflow on detail pages
useMediaQuery hook for hydration-safe responsive logic
Modal edge padding (p-4) prevents modals from touching screen edges
NoticePopup explicitly sets min-w/min-h [44px] on close button
User name truncation (max-w-[120px]) in mobile header and sidebar

not_tested: TextEditor (TipTap) toolbar mobile behavior - requires runtime testing
KakaoAddressSearch popup on mobile - third-party component
List/index pages (notice list, free board list, etc.) - not in scope of assigned scenarios

cross_cutting_issues_from_other_testers.title: useDeleteNotice missing ownership/role guard
cross_cutting_issues_from_other_testers.description: Delete mutation has no author_id or role check. Any authenticated user can delete any notice. UI hides button for non-admins, but mutation is unguarded. Mobile user Sam could trigger this via direct mutation call.
cross_cutting_issues_from_other_testers.mobile_relevance: LOW - UI correctly hides delete button for non-admin users, so mobile user would not see it. However, the underlying mutation is exploitable.

cross_cutting_issues_from_other_testers.title: Cascade-delete ordering bug in useDeleteFreeBoard and useDeleteQuestion
cross_cutting_issues_from_other_testers.description: Files and comments are deleted BEFORE ownership check on the post. If non-owner triggers mutation, files/comments are permanently lost even though post survives.
cross_cutting_issues_from_other_testers.mobile_relevance: LOW - Same UI-level guard applies; mobile user would not see delete button unless they are the author.
